author: Aristotle
quote: Man is by nature a political animal.

author: Andrea Gibson
quote: Remind me that the most fertile lands were built by the fires of volcanoes.

author: Chief Seattle
quote: Take nothing but memories, leave nothing but footprints!

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: Consistency is contrary to nature, contrary to life. The only completely consistent people are dead.

author: Winston S. Churchill
quote: An appeaser is one who feeds a crocodile, hoping it will eat him last.

author: Whitehead
quote: Speech is human nature itself, with none of the artificiality of written language

author: Georg Trakl
quote: I drank the silence of God from a spring in the woods.

author: Karolina Kurkova
quote: Mother Nature made me the way I am, and I should be happy.

author: Schopenhauer
quote: Politeness is to human nature what warmth is to wax.

author: Laurence J. Peter
quote: Every girl should use what Mother Nature gave her before Father Time takes it away.

author: J. Paul Getty
quote: In Japan, I was immensely impressed by the politeness, industrious nature and conscientiousness of the Japanese people.

author: Frances Hodgson Burnett
quote: "Is the spring coming?" he said. "What is it like?"... "It is the sun shining on the rain and the rain falling on the sunshine..."

author: Donleavy
quote: I got disappointed in human nature as well and gave it up because I found it too much like my own.

author: Mary Oliver
quote: Snow was falling, so much like stars filling the dark trees that one could easily imagine its reason for being was nothing more than prettiness.

author: Moore
quote: It is human nature to stand in the middle of a thing.

author: Mattie Stepanek
quote: Sunset is still my favorite color, and rainbow is second.

author: Mark Twain
quote: In the Spring, I have counted 136 different kinds of weather inside of 24 hours.

author: William Wordsworth
quote: The ocean is a mighty harmonist.

author: Georgia O'Keeffe
quote: I decided that if I could paint that flower in a huge scale, you could not ignore its beauty.

author: Emma Goldman
quote: I'd rather have roses on my table than diamonds on my neck.

author: John Paul Jones
quote: It seems to be a law of nature, inflexible and inexorable, that those who will not risk cannot win.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
quote: It is the nature of truth in general, as of some ores in particular, to be richest when most superficial.

author: John Muir
quote: The mountains are calling and I must go.

author: Elisabeth KÃ¼bler-Ross
quote: Should you shield the canyons from the windstorms you would never see the true beauty of their carvings.

author: Unknown
quote: When the wind is in the east, tis neither good for man nor beast.

author: Shakespeare
quote: My nature is subdued to what it works in, like the dyer's hand.

author: Henri Matisse
quote: There are always flowers for those who want to see them.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
quote: For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream.

author: John Joly
quote: That the sea is one of the most beautiful and magnificent sights in Nature, all admit.

author: Thomas Moore
quote: And the heart that is soonest awake to the flowers is always the first to be touch'd by the thorns.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.

author: Unknown
quote: The shoemaker's children have no shoes.

author: Samuel Butler
quote: Human life is as evanescent as the morning dew or a flash of lightning.

author: Sterne
quote: Only the brave know how to forgive; it is the most refined and generous pitch of virtue human nature can arrive at.

author: Jacques Yves Cousteau
quote: The sea, once it casts its spell, holds one in its net of wonder forever.

author: African Proverb
quote: No man fears what he has seen grow.

author: John Keats
quote: Scenery is fine - but human nature is finer.

author: Pamela Hansford Johnson
quote: The sky broke like an egg into full sunset and the water caught fire.

author: Alexander Smith
quote: Death is the ugly fact which Nature has to hide, and she hides it well.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Nature will bear the closest inspection. She invites us to lay our eye level with her smallest leaf, and take an insect view of its plain.

author: W.S. Gilbert
quote: Man is Nature's sole mistake.

author: Unknown
quote: The earth has music for those who listen.

author: Gautama Buddha
quote: To become vegetarian is to step into the stream which leads to nirvana.

author: Bill Watterson
quote: Look! A trickle of water running through some dirt! I'd say our afternoon just got booked solid!

author: Hippocrates
quote: Everything in excess is opposed to nature.

author: Unknown
quote: The sap rises in the spring.

author: H. G. Wells
quote: Adapt or perish, now as ever, is nature's inexorable imperative.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.

author: Pablo Neruda
quote: I want to do to you what spring does with the cherry trees.

author: Jacques Yves Cousteau
quote: The happiness of the bee and the dolphin is to exist. For man it is to know that and to wonder at it.

author: Robert Smithson
quote: Parks are idealizations of nature, but nature in fact is not a condition of the ideal.

author: Henri Rousseau
quote: Nothing makes me so happy as to observe nature and to paint what I see.

author: Mary Shelley
quote: The very winds whispered in soothing accents, and maternal Nature bade me weep no more.

author: Antoni Gaudi
quote: Anything created by human beings is already in the great book of nature.

author: Georges Simenon
quote: The lake and the mountains have become my landscape, my real world.

author: Alice Walker
quote: I think it pisses God off if you walk by the color purple in a field somewhere and don't notice it.

author: Marquis de Sade
quote: There is no God, Nature sufficeth unto herself; in no wise hath she need of an author.

author: Rose Kennedy
quote: Birds sing after a storm; why shouldn't people feel as free to delight in whatever sunlight remains to them?

author: Thomas Hobbes
quote: In the state of nature profit is the measure of right.

author: Moliere
quote: One should examine oneself for a very long time before thinking of condemning others

author: Edwin Way Teale
quote: For the mind disturbed, the still beauty of dawn is nature's finest balm.

author: Mother Angelica
quote: At Baptism, I received grace - that quality that makes me share in the very nature of God.

author: Roy Rogers
quote: What's a butterfly garden without butterflies?

author: Goldman
quote: Poor human nature, what horrible crimes have been committed in thy name!

author: Soren Kierkegaard
quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.

author: Confucius
quote: Music produces a kind of pleasure which human nature cannot do without

author: Marilyn Monroe
quote: Sex is a part of nature. I go along with nature.

author: William Wordsworth
quote: Come forth into the light of things, let nature be your teacher.

author: The Notorious B.I.G.
quote: I hold grudges, but I can't hate nobody; that's not my nature.

author: Luigi Pirandello
quote: Nature uses human imagination to lift her work of creation to even higher levels.

author: Isaac Asimov
quote: To insult someone we call him 'bestial'. For deliberate cruelty and nature, 'human' might be the greater insult.

author: Aldo Leopold
quote: I am glad I will not be young in a future without wilderness.

author: Juvenal
quote: Never does Nature say one thing and Wisdom another.

author: Euclid
quote: The laws of nature are but the mathematical thoughts of God.

author: Henry Brooks Adams
quote: Chaos was the law of nature; Order was the dream of man.

author: Amit Ray
quote: Looking at beauty in the world, is the first step of purifying the mind.

author: Bryan Procter
quote: Oh, the summer night, Has a smile of light, And she sits on a sapphire throne.

author: Victor Hugo
quote: What would be ugly in a garden constitutes beauty in a mountain.

author: Don Marquis
quote: Pity the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.

author: William C. Bryant
quote: Go forth under the open sky, and list To Nature's teachings.

author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quote: Space exploration is a force of nature unto itself that no other force in society can rival.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
quote: In nature there are neither rewards nor punishments; there are consequences.

author: Aristotle
quote: If one way be better than another, that you may be sure is nature's way.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.

author: Wilkinson
quote: It's human nature to always look at what your neighbor is doing.

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Man can never be a woman's equal in the spirit of selfless service with which nature has endowed her.

author: Jeffers
quote: Cruelty is a part of nature, at least of human nature, but it is the one thing that seems unnatural to us

author: Coleridge
quote: Those who best know human nature will acknowledge most fully what a strength light hearted nonsense give to a hard working man

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Nature is an endless combination and repetition of a very few laws.

author: Chen Shui-bian
quote: Even if one tree falls down it wouldn't affect the entire forest.

author: Auguste Rodin
quote: To the artist there is never anything ugly in nature.

author: Saint Augustine
quote: Miracles are not contrary to nature, but only contrary to what we know about nature.

author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
quote: Love is a strange master, and human nature is still stranger.

author: Anne Bronte
quote: A light wind swept over the corn, and all nature laughed in the sunshine.

author: Pat Buckley
quote: I can find God in nature, in animals, in birds and the environment.

author: Claude Monet
quote: I am following Nature without being able to grasp her, I perhaps owe having become a painter to flowers.

author: Maggie Stiefvater
quote: If I were a tree, I would have no reason to love a human.

author: R. Buckminster Fuller
quote: There is nothing in a caterpillar that tells you it's going to be a butterfly.

author: Thomas Hood
quote: I saw old Autumn in the misty morn stand shadowless like silence, listening to silence.

author: Edouard Manet
quote: There are no lines in nature, only areas of colour, one against another.

author: George Carlin
quote: There are nights when the wolves are silent and only the moon howls.

author: Lichtenberg
quote: What is called an acute knowledge of human nature is mostly nothing but the observer's own weaknesses reflected back from others.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
quote: If you truly love nature, you will find beauty everywhere.

author: Morgan Rhodes
quote: Evil is a choice one makes, not a natural state of being.

author: Juvenal
quote: Never does nature say one thing and wisdom another.

author: Aristotle
quote: All human actions have one or more of these seven causes: chance, nature, compulsions, habit, reason, passion, desire.

author: E. O. Wilson
quote: When you have seen one ant, one bird, one tree, you have not seen them all.

author: Thomas Jefferson
quote: There is not a sprig of grass that shoots uninteresting to me.

author: Mason Cooley
quote: Human society sustains itself by transforming nature into garbage.

author: Theodore Roethke
quote: Over every mountain there is a path, although it may not be seen from the valley.

author: Erin Hanson
quote: Because the birdsong might be pretty, But it's not for you they sing, And if you think my winter is too cold, You don't deserve my spring.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: The bluebird carries the sky on his back.

author: John Marsden
quote: We kill all the caterpillars, then complain there are no butterflies.

author: Philip Sidney
quote: It is the nature of the strong heart, that like the palm tree it strives ever upwards when it is most burdened.

author: Blaise Pascal
quote: The least movement is of importance to all nature. The entire ocean is affected by a pebble.

author: John Muir
quote: Of all the paths you take in life, make sure a few of them are dirt.

author: Westcott
quote: I reckon there's as much human nature in some folks as there is in others, if not more

author: Garrison Keillor
quote: Cats are intended to teach us that not everything in nature has a function.

author: Zebehazy
quote: One of the most secure markets in the world is human nature, few understand it, all have it.

author: W. H. Auden
quote: 'Healing', Papa would tell me, 'is not a science, but the intuitive art of wooing nature.'

author: Lucy Maud Montgomery
quote: Twilight drops her curtain down, and pins it with a star.

author: Jean Ingelow
quote: The moon looks upon many night flowers; the night flowers see but one moon.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: Every artist dips his brush in his own soul, and paints his own nature into his pictures.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
quote: Water is the driving force of all nature.

author: George Santayana
quote: To be interested in the changing seasons is a happier state of mind than to be hopelessly in love with spring.

author: Tennessee Williams
quote: The violets in the mountains have broken the rocks.

author: Michael Pollan
quote: The garden suggests there might be a place where we can meet nature halfway.

author: John Webster
quote: Eagles commonly fly alone. They are crows, daws, and starlings that flock together.

author: Edmund Burke
quote: We must all obey the great law of change. It is the most powerful law of nature.

author: Julie Andrews
quote: By nature, I really am a fairly bouncy and sunny individual.

author: Twain
quote: There is a great deal of human nature in people.

author: Ingrid Bergman
quote: A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous.

author: Richard Bach
quote: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world the master calls a butterfly.

author: Voltaire
quote: We are all full of weakness and errors; let us mutually pardon each other our follies - it is the first law of nature.

author: Richard P. Feynman
quote: See that the imagination of nature is far, far greater than the imagination of man.

author: John Muir
quote: Going to the woods is going home.

author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
quote: One must ask children and birds how cherries and strawberries taste.

author: Coco Chanel
quote: Nature gives you the face you have at twenty; it is up to you to merit the face you have at fifty.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: Those who contemplate the beauty of the earth find reserves of strength that will endure as long as life lasts.

author: Saint Teresa of Avila
quote: The tree that is beside the running water is fresher and gives more fruit.

author: Unknown
quote: One step leads to another.

author: Helen Keller
quote: To me a lush carpet of pine needles or spongy grass is more welcome than the most luxurious Persian rug.

author: Bhumibol Adulyadej
quote: Nature is something outside our body, but the mind is within us.

author: John Keats
quote: The poetry of the earth is never dead.

author: Alfred Lord Tennyson
quote: Words, like nature, half reveal and half conceal the soul within.

author: John McGraw
quote: My boy, one small breeze doesn't make a wind storm.

author: Jean Giraudoux
quote: The flower is the poetry of reproduction. It is an example of the eternal seductiveness of life.

author: Langston Hughes
quote: Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: That which is not good for the bee-hive cannot be good for the bees.

author: James Montgomery
quote: Blue thou art, intensely blue; Flower, whence came thy dazzling hue?

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Nature is not human hearted.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Our task must be to free ourselves... by widening our circle of compassion to embrace all living creatures and the whole of nature and it's beauty.

author: Hattie Morahan
quote: I am fascinated by people's flaws and delusions: all the messy bits of human nature we all try to pretend we don't have.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Live in each season as it passes; breathe the air, drink the drink, taste the fruit, and resign yourself to the influence of the earth.

author: Eric Hoffer
quote: Creativity is the ability to introduce order into the randomness of nature.

author: Thomas Campbell
quote: Tis distance lends enchantment to the view, and robes the mountain in its azure hue.

author: Dag Hammarskjold
quote: Never measure the height of a mountain until you have reached the top. Then you will see how low it was.

author: Jimmy Carter
quote: Like music and art, love of nature is a common language that can transcend political or social boundaries.

author: Grossman
quote: I think that's just human nature to make you want to work harder to improve yourself, and I think that'll be a positive for me.

author: Pinker
quote: All of us have a theory about human nature.

author: Alexander Hamilton
quote: There is a certain enthusiasm in liberty, that makes human nature rise above itself, in acts of bravery and heroism.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: A morning-glory at my window satisfies me more than the metaphysics of books.

author: Pete Hamill
quote: I don't ask for the meaning of the song of a bird or the rising of the sun on a misty morning. There they are, and they are beautiful.

author: Marie Curie
quote: All my life through, the new sights of Nature made me rejoice like a child.

author: Unknown
quote: It is a pleasure to give advice, humiliating to need it, normal to ignore it.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
quote: O, wind, if winter comes, can spring be far behind?

author: Robin Williams
quote: Spring is nature's way of saying, 'Let's party!'

author: Bill Watterson
quote: If people sat outside and looked at the stars each night, I'll bet they'd live a lot differently.

author: Frank Lloyd Wright
quote: I believe in God, only I spell it Nature.

author: Hebbel
quote: Whoever wants to be a judge of human nature should study people's excuses

author: Khalil Gibran
quote: Forget not that the earth delights to feel your bare feet and the winds long to play with your hair.

author: Satchel Paige
quote: Don't pray when it rains if you don't pray when the sun shines.

author: William James
quote: The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated.

author: Claude Monet
quote: I perhaps owe having become a painter to flowers.

author: Rainer Maria Rilke
quote: If we surrendered to earth's intelligence we could rise up rooted, like trees.

author: Guru Nanak
quote: Even Kings and emperors with heaps of wealth and vast dominion cannot compare with an ant filled with the love of God.

author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
quote: The very nature of science is discoveries, and the best of those discoveries are the ones you don't expect.

author: Walt Disney
quote: All cartoon characters and fables must be exaggeration, caricatures. It is the very nature of fantasy and fable.

author: Laurence Sterne
quote: Only the brave know how to forgive... a coward never forgave; it is not in his nature.

author: Albert Camus
quote: In the depth of winter I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.

author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca
quote: A happy life is one which is in accordance with its own nature.

author: BjÃ¶rk
quote: I never really understood the word âlonelinessâ. As far as I was concerned, I was in an orgy with the sky and the ocean, and with nature.

author: Isaac Newton
quote: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy

author: Che Guevara
quote: Study hard so that you can master technology, which allows us to master nature.

author: H. P. Lovecraft
quote: Ocean is more ancient than the mountains, and freighted with the memories and the dreams of Time.

author: Rudyard Kipling
quote: Borrow trouble for yourself, if that's your nature, but don't lend it to your neighbours.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: The butterfly counts not months but moments, and has time enough.

author: Adolf Hitler
quote: As in everything, nature is the best instructor.

author: Unknown
quote: The early bird gets the worm, the second mouse gets the cheese.

author: Neil Young
quote: Earth is a flower and it's pollinating.

author: Stowe
quote: Human nature is above all thingslazy.

author: Robert Fulghum
quote: I believe it is in my nature to dance by virtue of the beat of my heart, the pulse of my blood and the music in my mind.

author: Elizabeth I
quote: Fear not, we are of the nature of the lion, and cannot descend to the destruction of mice and such small beasts.

author: Swami Vivekananda
quote: External nature is only internal nature writ large.

author: Unknown
quote: It is almost impossible to smile on the outside without feeling better on the inside.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: Heaven is under our feet as well as over our heads.

author: Julie Bowen
quote: I'm so not stylish by nature, but I've learned to work with what I have.

author: Voltaire
quote: The art of medicine consists in amusing the patient while nature cures the disease.

author: William Hazlett
quote: We do not see nature with our eyes, but with our understandings and our hearts.

author: Radhanath Swami
quote: Mother Nature is always speaking. She speaks in a language understood within the peaceful mind of the sincere observer.

author: Isaac Newton
quote: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy.

author: Loren Eiseley
quote: One could not pluck a flower without troubling a star.

author: Jane Austen
quote: To sit in the shade on a fine day and look upon verdure is the most perfect refreshment.

author: Goethe
quote: It is in human nature to relax, when not compelled by personal advantage or disadvantage.

author: Socrates
quote: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.

author: Aristotle
quote: In all things of nature there is something of the marvelous.

author: Chip Conley
quote: In general, I'm not much into etiquette and am a rule-breaker and rebel by nature.

author: Andy Warhol
quote: I think having land and not ruining it is the most beautiful art that anybody could ever want.

author: John Muir
quote: The world's big and I want to have a good look at it before it gets dark.

author: Robert Frost
quote: The woods are lovely, dark and deep. But I have promises to keep, and miles to go before I sleep.

author: Marker
quote: Human nature being what it is, we tend to say we're following all the guidelines when in reality we're not.

author: James Whitcomb Riley
quote: When I see a bird that walks like a duck and swims like a duck and quacks like a duck, I call that bird a duck.

author: Honore de Balzac
quote: Clouds symbolize the veils that shroud God.

author: Hans Hofmann
quote: In nature, light creates the color. In the picture, color creates the light.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: To become an able and successful man in any profession, three things are necessary, nature, study and practice.

author: Joyce Carol Oates
quote: Night comes to the desert all at once, as if someone turned off the light.

author: Antoni Gaudi
quote: Nothing is art if it does not come from nature.

author: Al Gore
quote: Airplane travel is nature's way of making you look like your passport photo.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: I too am not a bit tamed, I too am untranslatable, I sound my barbaric yawp over the roofs of the world.

author: Henry Adams
quote: Chaos was the law of nature; Order was the dream of man.

author: Aristotle
quote: Nature does nothing in vain.

author: Blaise Pascal
quote: Nature is an infinite sphere of which the center is everywhere and the circumference nowhere.

author: Voltaire
quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: One touch of nature makes the whole world kin.

author: Thomas Guthrie
quote: As in nature, as in art, so in grace; it is rough treatment that gives souls, as well as stones, their luster.

author: John Muir
quote: The clearest way into the Universe is through a forest wilderness.

author: William Shakespeare
quote: I like this place and could willingly waste my time in it.

author: Emile M. Cioran
quote: What would be left of our tragedies if an insect were to present us his?

author: Phyllis Schlafly
quote: Feminism is doomed to failure because it is based on an attempt to repeal and restructure human nature.

author: Andy Goldsworthy
quote: Even in winter an isolated patch of snow has a special quality.

author: Henry Ward Beecher
quote: Flowers are the sweetest things God ever made and forgot to put a soul into.

author: George Washington Carver
quote: I love to think of nature as an unlimited broadcasting station, through which God speaks to us every hour, if we will only tune in.

author: Robert Green Ingersoll
quote: In nature there are neither rewards or punishments - there are consequences.

author: Perry
quote: We've thought about it. It's human nature. I'm not going to lie about it. But we know we have to get by this game.

author: Rachel Carson
quote: Some of nature's most exquisite handiwork is on a miniature scale, as anyone knows who has applied a magnifying glass to a snowflake.

author: Joseph Campbell
quote: The goal of life is to make your heartbeat match the beat of the universe, to match your nature with Nature.

author: Hal Borland
quote: Knowing trees, I understand the meaning of patience. Knowing grass, I can appreciate persistence.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
quote: Politeness is to human nature what warmth is to wax.

author: E. O. Wilson
quote: Nature holds the key to our aesthetic, intellectual, cognitive and even spiritual satisfaction.

author: Miranda Kerr
quote: When I pray, I always thank Mother Nature for all the beauty in the world. It's about having an attitude of gratitude.

author: Heraclitus
quote: Nature is wont to hide herself.

author: Zane Grey
quote: Love of man for woman - love of woman for man. That's the nature, the meaning, the best of life itself.

author: Moliere
quote: The trees that are slow to grow bear the best fruit.

author: Sherwood Smith
quote: The only noise now was the rain, pattering softly with the magnificent indifference of nature for the tangled passions of humans.

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
quote: Mountains are earth's undecaying monuments.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Adopt the pace of nature: her secret is patience.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Nature is a mutable cloud which is always and never the same.

author: Mao Zedong
quote: Let a hundred flowers bloom, let a hundred schools of thought contend.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The earth laughs in flowers.

author: Young
quote: I think it's human nature that we all tend to do much better in groups than we do alone.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The happiest man is he who learns from nature the lesson of worship

author: Shaw
quote: There is nothing that can be changed more completely than human nature when the job is taken in hand early enough.

author: William Wordsworth
quote: Nature never did betray the heart that loved her.

author: Hesse
quote: The man of power is ruined by power, the man of money by money, the submissive man by subservience, the pleasure seeker by pleasure.

author: Theodore Roethke
quote: Deep in their roots, all flowers keep the light.

author: Robert Browning
quote: I trust in nature for the stable laws of beauty and utility. Spring shall plant and autumn garner to the end of time.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
quote: The sunlight claps the earth, and the moonbeams kiss the sea: what are all these kissings worth, if thou kiss not me?

author: Vladimir Nabokov
quote: The breaking of a wave cannot explain the whole sea.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
quote: If I had to choose a religion, the sun as the universal giver of life would be my god.

author: D. H. Lawrence
quote: The fairest thing in nature, a flower, still has its roots in earth and manure.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: I believe a leaf of grass is no less than the journey-work of the stars.

author: Nathaniel Hawthorne
quote: Sunlight is painting.

author: Brian McDermott
quote: I can't go against my nature because I am what I am. I don't try to be anyone different to who I am.

author: C. JoyBell C.
quote: You will manage to keep a woman in love with you, only for as long as you can keep her in love with the person she becomes when she is with you.

author: Arthur C. Clarke
quote: Human judges can show mercy. But against the laws of nature, there is no appeal.

author: Stone
quote: I don't think so. Human nature is pretty nasty.

author: Walt Disney
quote: You can't just let nature run wild.

author: Paul Muni
quote: Nature's far too subtle to repeat herself.

author: Wallace Stevens
quote: In the world of words, the imagination is one of the forces of nature.

author: Thomas a Kempis
quote: Purity and simplicity are the two wings with which man soars above the earth and all temporary nature.

author: Paula Stokes
quote: To me, Mother Nature isn't nearly as scary as human nature.

author: Natalie Angier
quote: The beauty of the natural world lies in the details.

author: H. P. Lovecraft
quote: But more wonderful than the lore of old men and the lore of books is the secret lore of ocean.

author: Alan Hovhaness
quote: I've always regarded nature as the clothing of God.

author: Baruch Spinoza
quote: Nature abhors a vacuum.

author: Louis Nizer
quote: A beautiful lady is an accident of nature. A beautiful old lady is a work of art.

author: Edward Abbey
quote: Nature is indifferent to our love, but never unfaithful.

author: Albert Camus
quote: Autumn is a second spring when every leaf is a flower.

author: L. Wolfe Gilbert
quote: Those who find beauty in all of nature will find themselves at one with the secrets of life itself.

author: Dave Davies
quote: Being alone on the moors is scary; as the rain clouds settle in, it makes you realise your place in nature.

author: Hamilton
quote: In the general course of human nature, A power over a man's subsistence amounts to a power over his will.

author: Aristotle
quote: All men by nature desire knowledge.

author: James St. James
quote: The true nature of evil is that it is so very casual.

author: Arthur C. Clarke
quote: How inappropriate to call this planet Earth when it is quite clearly Ocean.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: There are moments when all anxiety and stated toil are becalmed in the infinite leisure and repose of nature.

author: Gary Snyder
quote: Nature is not a place to visit. It is home.

author: Gia Coppola
quote: Now that I'm older, I have a much better appreciation of nature, and I love being alone.

author: Louie Schwartzberg
quote: Nature's beauty is a gift that cultivates appreciation and gratitude.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: The creation of a thousand forests is in one acorn

author: France
quote: It is human nature to think wisely and act foolishly.

author: H. P. Lovecraft
quote: Blue, green, grey, white, or black; smooth, ruffled, or mountainous; that ocean is not silent.

author: Marianne Williamson
quote: Nature is infinitely creative. It is always producing the possibility of new beginnings.

author: Scott Westerfeld
quote: It's amazing how quickly nature consumes human places after we turn our backs on them. Life is a hungry thing.

author: Eleanor Roosevelt
quote: Perhaps nature is our best assurance of immortality.

author: Blaise Pascal
quote: Nature is an infinite sphere whose center is everywhere and circumference nowhere.

author: Richard Jefferies
quote: This sunlight linked me through the ages to that past consciousness.

author: Gary Speed
quote: Everybody makes mistakes, but when goalkeepers make them, it is costly. That's the nature of being a goalkeeper.

author: Werner Heisenberg
quote: What we observe is not nature itself, but nature exposed to our method of questioning.

author: Pinker
quote: Evolutionary psychology is one of four sciences that are bringing human nature back into the picture.

author: Lorraine Anderson
quote: Nature has been for me, for as long as I remember, a source of solace, inspiration, adventure, and delight; a home, a teacher, a companion.

author: Kin Hubbard
quote: A bee is never as busy as it seems; it's just that it can't buzz any slower.

author: Spurgeon
quote: You cannot slander human nature; it is worse than words can paint it.

author: Michelangelo
quote: My soul can find no staircase to Heaven unless it be through Earth's loveliness.

author: Chad Sugg
quote: Love the trees until their leaves fall off, then encourage them to try again next year.

author: Graham Greene
quote: Human nature is not black and white but black and grey.

author: Leigh Hunt
quote: Colors are the smiles of nature.

author: Mead
quote: Human nature is potentially aggressive and destructive and potentially orderly and constructive

author: H.G. Wells
quote: Adapt or perish, now as ever, is nature's inexorable imperative.

author: Roger Miller
quote: Some people walk in the rain, others just get wet.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
quote: When I have a terrible need of - shall I say the word - religion. Then I go out and paint the stars.

author: Aesop
quote: It is not only fine feathers that make fine birds.

author: Euripides
quote: There is the sky, which is all men's together.

author: Rabindranath Tagore
quote: Trees are the earth's endless effort to speak to the listening heaven.

author: Vincent van Gogh
quote: ...and then, I have nature and art and poetry, and if that is not enough, what is enough?

author: Bridget Riley
quote: For me nature is not landscape, but the dynamism of visual forces.

author: Arquette
quote: For movie "Human Nature": "I made a pubic wig.

author: Fuller
quote: Nature is trying very hard to make us succeed, but nature does not depend on us. We are not the only experiment.

author: John Muir
quote: There is not a fragment in all nature, for every relative fragment of one thing is a full harmonious unit in itself.

author: Charles Dickens
quote: Nature gives to every time and season some beauties of its own.

author: Walt Disney
quote: I don't like formal gardens. I like wild nature. It's just the wilderness instinct in me, I guess.

author: Edward Abbey
quote: Wilderness is not a luxury but a necessity of the human spirit.

author: Evangeline Lilly
quote: If you can't sit in a cafe quietly and be ignored, how can you observe human nature and write a story?

author: Ansel Adams
quote: Yosemite Valley, to me, is always a sunrise, a glitter of green and golden wonder in a vast edifice of stone and space.

author: Claude Monet
quote: My wish is to stay always like this, living quietly in a corner of nature.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: He who hears the rippling of rivers in these degenerate days will not utterly despair.

author: Stowe
quote: Human nature is above all thingsÃ¢â¬âlazy.

author: Charles Baudelaire
quote: I should like the fields tinged with red, the rivers yellow and the trees painted blue. Nature has no imagination.

author: Aldous Huxley
quote: My father considered a walk among the mountains as the equivalent of churchgoing.

author: Landor
quote: Everything that looks to the future elevates human nature

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: The good man is the friend of all living things.

author: Paul Dirac
quote: Pick a flower on Earth and you move the farthest star.

author: Larry Niven
quote: Mother Nature doesn't care if you're having fun.

author: Duke Ellington
quote: Gray skies are just clouds passing over.

author: Robert Delaunay
quote: Light in Nature creates the movement of colors.

author: Truman Capote
quote: Love is a chain of love as nature is a chain of life.

author: Russell Baker
quote: Ah, summer, what power you have to make us suffer and like it.

author: Paul Cezanne
quote: Painting from nature is not copying the object; it is realizing one's sensations.

author: Mercedes Ruehl
quote: Nature chooses who will be transgender; individuals don't choose this.

author: Hazlitt
quote: His works (taken together) are almost like a new edition of human nature.

author: Sir Francis Bacon
quote: Nature is often hidden, sometimes overcome, seldom extinguished.

author: R. Buckminster Fuller
quote: Nature is trying very hard to make us succeed, but nature does not depend on us. We are not the only experiment.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Many eyes go through the meadow, but few see the flowers in it

author: Marquis de Sade
quote: Your body is the church where Nature asks to be reverenced.

author: Matsuo Basho
quote: The temple bell stops but I still hear the sound coming out of the flowers.

author: Henry David Thoreau
quote: I believe that there is a subtle magnetism in Nature, which, if we unconsciously yield to it, will direct us aright.

author: Roy Bean
quote: And finally Winter, with its bitin', whinin' wind, and all the land will be mantled with snow.

author: John Lubbock
quote: Sunsets are so beautiful that they almost seem as if we were looking through the gates of Heaven.

author: Ella Maillart
quote: I had to live in the desert before I could understand the full value of grass in a green ditch.

author: Winston Churchill
quote: Solitary trees, if they grow at all, grow strong.

author: Marcus Aurelius
quote: Nothing happens to any man that he is not formed by nature to bear.

author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel
quote: Mere goodness can achieve little against the power of nature.

author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
quote: When one loses the deep intimate relationship with nature, then temples, mosques and churches become important.

author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec
quote: Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: We still do not know one thousandth of one percent of what nature has revealed to us.

author: Carl Sagan
quote: If you wish to make an apple pie from scratch, you must first invent the universe.

author: Johannes Kepler
quote: Nature uses as little as possible of anything.

author: Joseph Joubert
quote: When you go in search of honey you must expect to be stung by bees.

author: Hal Borland
quote: You can't be suspicious of a tree, or accuse a bird or a squirrel of subversion or challenge the ideology of a violet.

author: John Muir
quote: I only went out for a walk and finally concluded to stay out till sundown, for going out, I found, was really going in.

author: Annie Leibovitz
quote: I wish that all of nature's magnificence, the emotion of the land, the living energy of place could be photographed.

author: Margaret Atwood
quote: Nature is to zoos as God is to churches.

author: William Wordsworth
quote: Suffering is permanent, obscure and dark, And shares the nature of infinity.

author: David Bailey
quote: The skull is nature's sculpture.

author: Russel Honore
quote: People need to be cautious because anything built by man can be destroyed by Mother Nature.

author: John Updike
quote: Rain is grace; rain is the sky descending to the earth; without rain, there would be no life.

author: Steven Pinker
quote: Many artists and scholars have pointed out that ultimately art depends on human nature.

author: Benjamin Disraeli
quote: Nature, like man, sometimes weeps from gladness.

author: William Wordsworth
quote: For I have learned to look on nature, not as in the hour of thoughtless youth; but hearing oftentimes the still, sad music of humanity.

author: Brokaw
quote: They define something special in human nature. They give us a measure of what's possible and what's truly sensational or phenomenal.

author: Steve Maraboli
quote: Plant seeds of happiness, hope, success, and love; it will all come back to you in abundance. This is the law of nature.

author: Charlotte BrontÃ«
quote: I could not help it: the restlessness was in my nature; it agitated me to pain sometimes.

author: John Burroughs
quote: I go to nature to be soothed and healed, and to have my senses put in order.

author: Walt Whitman
quote: Give me odorous at sunrise a garden of beautiful flowers where I can walk undisturbed.

author: Philip James Bailey
quote: Simplicity is natures first step, and the last of art.

author: Margaret Atwood
quote: In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt.

author: Henrik Ibsen
quote: A forest bird never wants a cage.

author: Elizabeth Appell
quote: And the day came when the risk to remain tight in a bud was more painful than the risk it took to blossom.

author: Jo Walton
quote: There's a sunrise and a sunset every single day, and they're absolutely free. Don't miss so many of them.

author: Samuel Butler
quote: Self-preservation is the first law of nature.

author: Lao Tzu
quote: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.

author: Asquith
quote: The capacity to suffer varies more than anything that I have observed in human nature.

author: Stephen Gardiner
quote: The mystery is what prompted men to leave caves, to come out of the womb of nature.

author: Ambrose Bierce
quote: A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.

author: Christopher Heyerdahl
quote: Mother Nature is the great equalizer. You can't get away from it.

author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
quote: The best thing one can do when it's raining is to let it rain.

author: John Donne
quote: Nature's great masterpiece, an elephant; the only harmless great thing.

author: Matthew Williamson
quote: The peacock has become one of my regular sources of inspiration from nature.

author: Dave Barry
quote: Camping is nature's way of promoting the motel business.

author: Francis Bacon
quote: Nature is often hidden, sometimes overcome, seldom extinguished.

author: Pinker
quote: We may be seeing a coming together of the humanities and the science of human nature.

author: Alex Trebek
quote: If you can't be in awe of Mother Nature, there's something wrong with you.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Joy in looking and comprehending is nature's most beautiful gift.

author: Judy Garland
quote: Behind every cloud is another cloud.

author: Moore
quote: If the Martians can translate this and interpret it, it will give them an interesting view of human nature.

author: Napoleon Hill
quote: Failure is nature's plan to prepare you for great responsibilities.

author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.
quote: The Amen of nature is always a flower.

author: John Muir
quote: Another glorious day, the air as delicious to the lungs as nectar to the tongue.

author: Unknown
quote: A dripping June sets all in tune.

author: George Santayana
quote: The family is one of nature's masterpieces.

author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross
quote: Should you shield the canyons from the windstorms you would never see the true beauty of their carvings.

author: Samuel Johnson
quote: He that will enjoy the brightness of sunshine, must quit the coolness of the shade.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
quote: Nature always wears the colors of the spirit.

author: Richard P. Feynman
quote: Reality must take precedence over public relations, for nature cannot be fooled.
